metadata.synopsis: Hope spirit appears to tell about Archive, Archivist and treasures inside
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. CTY_Main_A2. Get to the triggerteleport S_LOW_HouseOfHope_HopeSpirit02Trigger

41.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
41.text: Hello again, little mouse. The price for speaking is steep, but I must give warning.
41.context: NodeContext: speaking in hushed tones, pleased to see the player

62.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
62.text: Your prize is just ahead, in the Archive, but you can't take it yet, and even if you could, you mustn't.
62.context: NodeContext: excited to tell you you're close to your prize, but disappointed to break the news that you can't take it yet

45.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
45.text: IN THIS HOUSE THIEVES ARE MELTED LIKE BUTTER AND SPREAD ONTO TOAST
45.context: NodeContext: raising volume as she blurts out a warning, losing control of her emotions

33.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
33.text: Shhhh... I'm doing it again I'm doing it again.
33.context: NodeContext: shushing hersel after an outburstf, and fussing at heself

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I need you to stay calm, Hope, and guide me.

61.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
61.text: I can I shall I can I shall.
61.context: NodeContext: determined, repeating as a mantra to give herself confidence

17.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
17.text: The Archivist is the key, but he's as stubborn as a king and as serious as a heart attack.
17.context: NodeContext: relaying important information as straightforwardly as she can

15.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
15.text: EXPLOIT HIS PIDDLING WEAKNESSES AND MAKE HIM GROVEL

11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
11.text: Oh no. They hear me... Speak quickly, speak softly, you know how this goes.
11.context: NodeContext: trying to compose herself, slowing down more than usual before the ellipsiss, and then speaking quickly ad quietly

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Concentrate on speaking softly and without emotion.

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *You steady your mind, and prepare your questions.*

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Is there anyone else I should be aware of in the Archive?

85.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
85.text: SISTER MY SISTER, OH WHAT HAVE YOU DONE, SOLD ME FOR SOUL SCRAPS, TORMENT ME FOR FUN
85.context: NodeContext: outburst, intentional rhyme, sad lament

56.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
56.text: My dearest sister Korrilla is in there too, pretending to browse the collection, acting all nonchalant. She's up to something.
56.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst, then suspicious

53.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
53.text: She won't let me escape. Not never ever never ever.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Sounds like we'll have more luck with the Archivist.

65.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
65.text: He fears authority figures. Perhaps his teacher took a strap to him and left a deep impression at an early age.
65.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst on the previous line - trying to relay important information

71.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
71.text: There's one regular visitor that he particularly fears... She is... shhhhhhh...
71.context: NodeContext: decreasing volume as she realises somebody is listening in... hushing herself

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *A crack like a breaking bone. Hope winces.*

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Who does the Archivist fear, Hope? I need a name.

13.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
13.text: SCARIER THINGS THAN YOU LITTLE MOUSE

47.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
47.text: Verillius... Verillius Receptor. A High Inquisitor of Zariel. Officially entitled to audit Raphael's collection.
47.context: NodeContext: in pain, delivering this information is costing her a lot. Slower than her normal speech patterns as she fights the pain.

27.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
27.text: Her true form is so gargantuan and mind-scarring to behold that she takes on many guises when she visits.
27.context: NodeContext: in awe as she describes a terrible devil

44.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
44.text: PLAY YOUR PART WELL AND YOU CAN BE ONE OF THOSE BLASPHEMOUS GUISES

16.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
16.text: IT'S ON THE TIP OF MY TONGUE BUT THEY SLICED OFF THE TIP OF MY TONGUE

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *Hope vanishes from sight, and the House seems to tighten around you like a constricting artery.*

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I need to get you out of here, Hope, before that jailor kills you.

25.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
25.text: YOU CAN'T THERE IS NO HOPE FOR HOPE

77.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
77.text: Not without the Hammer. It can shatter all infernal chains, including those that hold me.
77.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst, telling us what we need to know to help her

83.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
83.text: I will endure 'til you find me. Hope always does. And when you do find me -
83.context: NodeContext: speaking calmly and sadly, and pausing on the final word

8.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
8.text: WE WILL RIP OUT THEIR GIZZARDS

58.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
58.text: BUT FIRST GO GET THE HAMMER

2.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
2.text: BUT FIRST GO GET YOUR CONTRACT

29.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
29.text: Once you do, the House will bare its teeth, and you'll only have a few minutes to get me out of my prison before Raphael arrives.

34.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
34.text: AND THEN IT ALL COMES TUMBLING DOWN
34.context: NodeContext: gleeful outburst, despite the horror of the situation

59.speaker: Player
59.text: You're about as helpful as a blunt dagger.

37.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
37.text: AND YOU'RE ABOUT AS GRATEFUL AS A FLOWER IN A FURNACE
37.context: NodeContext: outburst of exasperated indignation aimed at uncooperative player

40.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
40.text: I'm doing the best I can. Please don't abandon me.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: She won't have a choice - I'm getting you out of here. Just tell me how.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: How should I deal with the Archivist?

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Why can't I just take what I came for?

68.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
68.text: TRY IT AND YOU WILL BE NOTHING BUT BONES

7.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
7.context: NodeContext: composing herself and lisitng out the things that might happen as if they're very specific and scientific, despite the vagueness of her warning

9.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
9.text: Trigger the alarm, and Raphael will come swooping home on wings of malice to rip out your soul.

78.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
78.text: Being here is a violation of so many subclauses and stipulations in your contract that Raphael will snuff out your soul the minute he catches sight of you.

18.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
18.text: YOU SHOULDN'T HAVE SIGNED IT YOU MAGNIFICENT MORON
18.context: NodeContext: outburst, exasperated with the player for signing a contract with Raphael

35.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
35.text: Unfortunately, it's the most prized item in the collection, so the 'no touching' rule is strictly enforced.
35.context: NodeContext: thinks very little of the 'no touching' rule, treating it like a kid would treat a rule not to speak in class

23.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
23.text: The Archivist is the key. EXPLOIT HIS FEARS AND LUSTS.
23.context: NodeContext: calm and serious on first sentence, and then an outburst of excited emotion on the second

36.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
36.text: The only thing that matters is the Hammer.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I don't need any advice - I already know the masterword to dispel the magic protecting the artefacts.

73.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
73.text: My heart just skipped a beat - you might just pull this off.

67.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
67.text: PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE TAKE ME WITH YOU WHEN YOU LEAVE

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *You hesitate a moment too long, and Hope begins to fidget and panic.*

26.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
26.text: I DON'T HEAR A THING, SIR JAILOR, EXCEPT FOR THE GENTLE CRACKING OF MY RIBS
26.context: NodeContext: calling out apologetically to an off-screen presence, with panic, attempting to placate

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Think two steps ahead, plotting out your queries in advance.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Focus your efforts on formulating concise questions.

39.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
39.text: I AM BEING BOILED ALIVE AND FILLED WITH A THOUSAND PINS
39.context: NodeContext: exasperated, the player is NOT taking her predicament seriously

60.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
60.text: But since you asked so politely, I'll calm myself.
60.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst

72.speaker: Player
72.text: You're more of a hindrance than a help.

46.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
46.text: AND YOU'RE MORE OF A HATSTAND THAN A HERO
46.context: NodeContext: nonsensical outburst after being insulted

38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
38.text: Sorry. Let's try this again. Apologies, apologies, apologies. You're not a hatstand at all.
38.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Focus, breathe with intent, and the flames that scorch your mind will recede, for they are nothing.

75.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
75.text: Slight problem. The flames are scorching my backside as well as my mind. But I like your optimism, and I can help.
75.context: NodeContext: awkwardly letting the player know tha tthey're advice didn't help all that much, but genuinely pleased that they're trying their best
